mn24:10.9.en: “The purpose of leading the spiritual life under the Buddha is extinguishment by not grasping.”

mn24:11.1.en: “Reverend, is purification of ethics extinguishment by not grasping?”

mn24:11.13.en: “Is purification of knowledge and vision extinguishment by not grasping?”

mn24:11.15.en: “Then is extinguishment by not grasping something apart from these things?”

mn24:13.1.pli: “Sīlavisuddhiñce, āvuso, bhagavā anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya, saupādānaṁyeva samānaṁ anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya.
mn24:13.1.en: “If the Buddha had declared purification of ethics to be extinguishment by not grasping, he would have declared that which has grasping to be extinguishment by not grasping. …

mn24:13.7.pli: Ñāṇadassanavisuddhiñce, āvuso, bhagavā anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya, saupādānaṁyeva samānaṁ anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya.
mn24:13.7.en: If the Buddha had declared purification of knowledge and vision to be extinguishment by not grasping, he would have declared that which has grasping to be extinguishment by not grasping.

mn24:13.8.pli: Aññatra ce, āvuso, imehi dhammehi anupādāparinibbānaṁ abhavissa, puthujjano parinibbāyeyya.
mn24:13.8.en: But if extinguishment by not grasping was something apart from these things, an ordinary person would become extinguished.

mn24:15.1.pli: “Evameva kho, āvuso, sīlavisuddhi yāvadeva cittavisuddhatthā, cittavisuddhi yāvadeva diṭṭhivisuddhatthā, diṭṭhivisuddhi yāvadeva kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhatthā, kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhi yāvadeva maggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhatthā, maggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhi yāvadeva paṭipadāñāṇadassanavisuddhatthā, paṭipadāñāṇadassanavisuddhi yāvadeva ñāṇadassanavisuddhatthā, ñāṇadassanavisuddhi yāvadeva anupādāparinibbānatthā.
mn24:15.1.en: “In the same way, reverend, purification of ethics is only for the sake of purification of mind. Purification of mind is only for the sake of purification of view. Purification of view is only for the sake of purification through overcoming doubt. Purification through overcoming doubt is only for the sake of purification of knowledge and vision of the variety of paths. Purification of knowledge and vision of the variety of paths is only for the sake of purification of knowledge and vision of the practice. Purification of knowledge and vision of the practice is only for the sake of purification of knowledge and vision. Purification of knowledge and vision is only for the sake of extinguishment by not grasping.

mn24:15.2.pli: Anupādāparinibbānatthaṁ kho, āvuso, bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ vussatī”ti.
mn24:15.2.en: The spiritual life is lived under the Buddha for the sake of extinguishment by not grasping.”

sn45.48:1.4.en: ‘The purpose of leading the spiritual life under the Buddha is extinguishment by not grasping.’

sn45.48:1.6.pli: ‘atthi panāvuso, maggo, atthi paṭipadā anupādāparinibbānāyā’ti, evaṁ puṭṭhā tumhe, bhikkhave, tesaṁ aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānaṁ evaṁ byākareyyātha:
sn45.48:1.6.en: ‘Is there a path and a practice for extinguishment by not grasping?’ You should answer them like this:

sn45.48:1.7.pli: ‘atthi kho, āvuso, maggo, atthi paṭipadā anupādāparinibbānāyā’ti.
sn45.48:1.7.en: ‘There is a path and a practice for extinguishment by not grasping.’

sn45.48:1.8.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, maggo, katamā ca paṭipadā anupādāparinibbānāya?
sn45.48:1.8.en: And what is that path, what is that practice for extinguishment by not grasping?

sn45.48:1.11.pli: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, maggo, ayaṁ paṭipadā anupādāparinibbānāyāti.
sn45.48:1.11.en: This is the path, this is the practice for extinguishment by not grasping.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 45
5. Abbreviated Texts on Followers of Other Paths
48. Extinguishment by Not Grasping

an7.55:1.1.pli: “Satta ca, bhikkhave, purisagatiyo desessāmi anupādā ca parinibbānaṁ.
an7.55:1.1.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you seven places people are reborn, and extinguishment by not grasping.

an7.55:9.1.en: And what is extinguishment by not grasping?

an7.55:9.7.en: This is called extinguishment by not grasping.

an7.55:9.8.pli: Imā kho, bhikkhave, satta purisagatiyo anupādā ca parinibbānan”ti.
an7.55:9.8.en: These are the seven places people are reborn, and extinguishment by not grasping.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 7
6. The Undeclared Points
55. Places People Are Reborn

an1.591-592:1.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpabhedāya saṁvattati … anupādāparinibbānāya saṁvattati.
an1.591-592:1.1.en: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to demolition by wisdom … to extinguishment by not grasping.

an1.591-592:1.4.pli: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpabhedāya saṁvattati … anupādāparinibbānāya saṁvattatī”ti.
an1.591-592:1.4.en: This one thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to demolition by wisdom … to extinguishment by not grasping.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 1
30. Mindfulness of the Body
575–615

sn35.75:7.1.pli: “Anupādāparinibbānatthaṁ khvāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
sn35.75:7.1.en: “I understand that the Buddha has taught the Dhamma for the purpose of complete extinguishment by not grasping.”

sn35.75:8.2.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, bhikkhu, anupādāparinibbānatthaṁ mayā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāsi.
sn35.75:8.2.en: It’s good that you understand that I’ve taught the Dhamma for the purpose of complete extinguishment by not grasping.

an10.29:21.2.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapentānaṁ yadidaṁ channaṁ phassāyatanānaṁ samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ viditvā anupādā vimokkho.
an10.29:21.2.en: This is the best of those who advocate extinguishment in this very life, that is, liberation by not grasping after truly understanding the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape of the six fields of contact.

an10.29:21.5.pli: Kāmānañcāhaṁ, bhikkhave, pariññaṁ paññāpemi, rūpānañca pariññaṁ paññāpemi, vedanānañca pariññaṁ paññāpemi, diṭṭheva dhamme nicchāto nibbuto sītibhūto anupādā parinibbānaṁ paññāpemī”ti.
an10.29:21.5.en: But I do advocate the complete understanding of sensual pleasures, sights, and feelings. And I advocate complete extinguishment by not grasping in this very life, wishless, extinguished, and cooled.”

29. Kosala (1st)
